Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Entanglement \En*tan"gle*ment\, n. 1. State of being entangled; intricate and confused involution; that which entangles; intricacy; perplexity. [1913 Webster]
2. (Mil.) An extensive low obstacle formed of stakes, stumps, or the like, connected by wires, ropes, or the like. [Webster 1913 Suppl.]
3. (Naut.) An obstruction of cables and spars across a river or harbor entrance. [Webster 1913 Suppl.]
entanglement n : an intricate trap that entangles or ensnares its victim [syn: {web}]
